item.title: The earth does not move
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

Mistranslated, this is why I dislike the KJV of the Bible because its translations are from one “not nearly evolved enough language” to another, essentially you lose meaning in so many places and it wasn’t until the oldest known texts were revisited that fallacies like this get debunked

The Original in KJV:

The LORD reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the LORD is clothed with strength, wherewith he hath girded himself: the world also is stablished, that it cannot be moved.

Maybe from this I could see how you could POSSIBLY make the jump to a non moving earth, but

The newly translated NLT:

The LORD reigns; he is robed in majesty; the LORD is robed; he has put on strength as his belt. Yes, the world is established; it shall never be moved.

Who knows what “Stablished” was translated from but anyone with a brain could tell it simply means “established”, I shall now give a definition of “Established”

from Google:

(of a custom, belief, practice, or institution) Having been in existence for a long time and therefore generally accepted.

from here you should clearly be able to see that “it shall never be moved” is directly referring to “unestablishing” it.

Read full topic

item.title: The earth does not move
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Possibly one of the most idiotic, arrogant bullshit thread I have ever bestowed my eyes upon in my entire five years of being in this community. The first person who had experimental evidence for this was the astronomer F.W. Bessel who in 1838 was able to measure the parallax of a nearby star. This showed that the earth was at a different place, relative to the star, in June than it was in January. And geometry showed that the two places were on opposite sides of the sun. More parallax measurements since his time have confirmed that the earth follows a closed path around the sun.

You can start with basic gravitational theory, throw in a little bit of ballistics and orbital mechanics, and of course our successful navigation of craft through the solar system, all of which show conclusively that the earth orbits the sun. The point is that it’s your responsibility, denying the common wisdom, to come up with a self consistent alternative. If you can’t find one, that in itself is an argument for the orbiting earth.

Incidentally, parallax shows that the stars move relative to the earth in an annual cycle, and abberation shows that light moves relative to the earth in an annual cycle. If you assume the earth stationary, then these are two curious unexplained facts, but if you assume it orbits, then it is explained, the earth is moving relative to the stars and as it moves its speed causes the abberation of light. Even the phases are in sync.
[hr]
As for religion; I’ve made myself quite clear on multiple occasions that I disbelieve in any such thing. I respect your beliefs, don’t go around making ignorant threads as such bashing on others. This is basically all Christians do, go around flaunting the Bible in anyone’s face who believes otherwise to “God’s” existence. If you’re a Christian, believe in what you wish to, respect that I don’t believe in that and leave me alone with your elitist, egotistical beliefs.

Read full topic

reyx7:

One of the easiest countering arguements to god created the earth would be who created god? By saying ‘he created himself’ would be the same as the universe creating itself, making that invalid. Religion should be seen as nothing but a set of values. Respect, honor, fellowship, and all of those ideas are put into any religion to prevent anarchy in a society, however when it comes to origination ideas we should be free to question that.
